Article Title: NFL Playoffs: Who will LA Rams face next in divisional round after win vs. Panthers
Article Text:
Who will the Rams face next in divisional round (Getty Images)

Who will the Rams play next?



Los Angeles Rams next playoff opponent is now the biggest question swirling around the NFC as the postseason tightens and margins grow thinner. Survival mattered more than style on wild-card weekend, and Los Angeles proved it can still win when the game slips toward chaos. Mistakes piled up, momentum swung, and the crowd held its breath. Yet when the season hung in the balance, the Rams leaned on experience and nerve.That grit carried them past Carolina in a 34-31 escape that felt more like a street fight than a statement. Early control vanished, turnovers haunted them, and special teams faltered. Still, Matthew Stafford refused to blink. With the clock draining and pressure mounting, he engineered a calm, precise drive that ended with Colby Parkinson crossing the goal line with 38 seconds left. It was not flawless football. It was winning football.The Rams now wait as the NFL ’s reseeded playoff bracket reshapes the road ahead. Their divisional-round opponent will emerge from a web of results still unfolding across wild-card weekend. Seattle sits comfortably with a bye, watching the rest of the field battle for position. Philadelphia and San Francisco clash on Sunday, while Chicago meets Green Bay under Saturday night lights.Several paths are in play. A Packers win paired with an Eagles victory sends Los Angeles to Philadelphia. If Green Bay wins and the 49ers advance, the Rams would host San Francisco in a rivalry soaked in history. Should Chicago knock off the Packers and Philadelphia survive, the Rams head north to face Seattle. If the Bears win and San Francisco moves on, Chicago becomes the destination.Each matchup brings a different emotional weight. Seattle carries recent familiarity and postseason confidence, where Los Angeles owns a perfect playoff record against the Seahawks. Chicago represents unfinished business after last season’s loss and memories of a distant but painful NFC title defeat. Philadelphia still stings, fresh off last year’s divisional heartbreak and a narrow regular-season loss. San Francisco is the oldest rivalry of them all, one that has swung wildly and delivered unforgettable January drama.What remains constant is the Rams’ position. This is their second straight divisional appearance and the 21st in franchise history. They have walked this path before, including the 2022 run that ended with a Super Bowl parade. Whoever lines up across from them next week will face a team that bends, survives, and believes when it matters most.Also Read: Matthew Stafford’s wife Kelly steals Wild Card spotlight with daring MVP claim and coordinated Rams looks for daughters
Article Summary: The Los Angeles Rams beat the Carolina Panthers 34-31 in the NFC wild-card game. Their divisional-round opponent will emerge from a web of results still unfolding. Seattle sits comfortably with a bye, while Philadelphia and San Francisco clash on Sunday. Chicago meets Green Bay under Saturday night lights.

Article Title: Packers vs Bears wild-card game turns into snowy survival test as Soldier Field disappears under whiteout
Article Text:
Snowy Conditions for Packers vs. Bears (Imagn Images and X/NFL)

Packers vs Bears snow game adds another chapter to a bitter rivalry



Packers vs Bears snow game instantly turns Soldier Field into a stage where football feels raw, loud, and beautifully unforgiving. Snow is a familiar enemy in Chicago, the kind that clings to boots and turns simple drives into slow battles. Yet when kickoff nears, that same nuisance becomes part of the theater. Early Saturday, a steady blanket of white covered Soldier Field, hinting that this matchup would not be clean or comfortable. For fans raised on frozen Sundays, the sight alone was enough to stir memories of old-school football, where grit mattered as much as talent.Cold-weather games have a way of pulling viewers in, even those far from the Midwest. Television loves it. So do fans. The swirling flakes, frozen breath, and muddied jerseys create drama no dome can match. Reporters on site shared images of the field slowly disappearing under snow, setting the tone hours before kickoff. This was not just another playoff game. It felt like an event.Green Bay has long embraced ugly conditions as part of its identity. The franchise lore is filled with snow-packed victories that shaped the NFL’s image, and this night offered another chance to lean into that history.Forecasts pointed to biting wind chills and gusts between 20 and 30 miles per hour, conditions that punish hesitation and reward discipline.Neither side entered unfamiliar territory. The rivals already traded wins during the regular season, splitting two cold December contests. Green Bay struck first in Week 14 with a 28-21 victory, only to watch Chicago answer two weeks later with a 22-16 overtime win. Those results set the stage for a tiebreaker that mattered far more.Chicago arrived confident under head coach Ben Johnson after capturing its first division title since 2018. The Bears offense closed the season averaging nearly 26 points per game, backed by a defense that thrived on chaos with a league-leading 33 takeaways. Green Bay’s case rested on quarterback Jordan Love , who delivered a sharp season marked by efficiency, poise, and protection of the football.Still, the snow did not hide every concern. Green Bay’s defense entered short-handed after losing Micah Parsons to a torn ACL, a blow that lingered through a rough finish to the regular season. In weather like this, depth matters. So does resolve.Also Read: Madison Beer’s jaw-dropping selfie steals spotlight as Justin Herbert prepares for Chargers-Patriots playoff clash

Article Title: “They were holding me in the tent”: Stefon Diggs breaks silence on Patriots medical tent drama
Article Text:
Stefon Diggs revealed why he fought to leave the Patriots’ medical tent during a December win over the Baltimore Ravens. After a hard fall, Diggs disputed concussion concerns, insisting his issue was his shoulder. He returned quickly, finishing with nine catches for 138 yards in a statement performance for the New England Patriots.

Why Stefon Diggs refused to stay sidelined

The moment barely lasted a few minutes, but it told a much bigger story about who Stefon Diggs is at this stage of his career. He was battling protocol, trainers, and the quiet fear that follows any hard fall in the NFL.Last year, the Patriots were early into their prime time matchup against the Baltimore Ravens when Diggs landed awkwardly after a big catch. What followed became one of the most talked about moments of New England’s late season push.After the game, Diggs did not dodge the questions. He leaned into them with raw honesty and a touch of humor. Article Title: “I have a great wife”: Patrick Mahomes says wife Brittany is the backbone of his success on and off the field

Article Title: Ben Roethlisberger net worth: Inside Steelers legend’s $100M empire, NFL contracts, real estate, and endorsements
Article Text:

Ben Roethlisberger contract details with Pittsburgh Steelers

Retired Ben Roethlisberger’s real estate properties

Big Ben endorsements and luxurious car garage

What does Ben “Big Ben” Roethlisberger do now?

Ben Roethlisberger won two Super Bowls playing quarterback for the Pittsburgh Steelers. In his first year, he had a 15-1 season record with 17 passing touchdowns. In 2005, his team defeated the Seattle Seahawks 21-10, and Roethlisberger became the youngest Super Bowl-winning quarterback in NFL history at 23. The record was previously held by New England Patriots legend Tom Brady. Brady boasts an estimated net worth of $300 to $350 million.According to Celebrity Net Worth, Roethlisberger’s net worth is $100 million. Ariadna Pinheiro of Bolavip US reported that Ben earned over $267 million in total career earnings from contracts during 18 NFL seasons. In 2019, his highest single-season salary was $40 million.In the 2004 NFL Draft, Roethlisberger signed a six-year, $22 million contract with the Pittsburgh Steelers. In March 2008, he signed a four-year contract extension worth $87.9 million with $25.2 million in bonuses.In March 2015, the legendary quarterback signed a four-year contract extension worth $87.4 million with the Pittsburgh Steelers. In April 2019, the two-time NFL passing yards leader signed a two-year contract extension worth $68 million.In March 2020, the six-time Pro Bowler converted $19.5 million in salary and bonuses to a signing bonus, clearing $9.5 million in cap space for Pittsburgh.In March 2021, he signed a one-year contract extension worth $14 million with the Steelers. In January 2022, “Big Ben” retired from the NFL.After his first contract with the Steelers, the two-time Super Bowl champion bought a plush 2,423 square-foot, 2.5-bathroom home in Pittsburgh for $475,000. However, he sold it for $360,500 in 2012.In 2006, “Big Ben” bought another home in Gibsonia, Pennsylvania, for $2.2 million. He added an indoor golf simulator, a garage for ATVs, and a kids’ playroom. However, he listed it for $2.7 million in 2019. When buyers did not appear, he settled for $2.2 million [the same he bought it for].In 2009, the Super Bowl XL Winner spent $2.277 million on a 148-acre property in Clinton, Pennsylvania. It included an expansive living room, an up-to-date kitchen, a game room, a family room, and a large wine cellar. The backyard features a shooting range, three ponds, a chicken coop, a woodshop, and green space with lush vegetation. However, he listed it for sale in 2023 for $2.9 million.In 2011, the one-time NFL Offensive Rookie of the Year purchased a lake house on the coast of Lake Oconee in Atlanta for $2.2 million.In 2015, the nine-time NFL Top 100 Player paid $2 million for a vacant 2-acre plot in affluent residential borough Sewickley Heights, Pennsylvania. He custom-built a mansion there, which was ready by 2018.The mansion now has 22,464 square feet of living space with an outdoor pool and spa. NHL’s Pittsburgh Penguins legend Sidney Crosby and NHL legend Mario Lemieux both live in the neighborhood.According to Bolavip US, Roethlisberger has earned substantial income from endorsement deals with top brands such as Panini, Nike, Upper Deck, Fanatics, and Sprint, reportedly earning between $1 million and $3 million annually. He was the face of Big Ben’s Beef Jerky by PLB Sports but discontinued it because of 2010 off-gridiron legal issues.JR Malabanan of ClutchPoints reported in April 2024 that Roethlisberger has a collection of high-end vehicles worth $4 million. He owns a Ferrari 488 GTB, an Alfa Romeo Disco Volante, a Mini Cooper Convertible, and a Hummer.Roethlisberger started the “Footbahlin with Ben Roethlisberger” podcast, which runs under the YouTube channel name “Channel Seven.” Launched in April 2022, it has over 122K subscribers and more than 12M views across 194 videos.A pivotal moment in his media career came only recently. He will join NFL quarterback legends Peyton and Eli Manning on the “ManningCast.”Jacob Punturi of Sports Illustrated recently reported that the Steelers legend will make his debut during the second half of the “ManningCast” episode, streaming on ESPN2 and ESPN+, during the Pittsburgh Steelers vs. Houston Texans Wild Card Weekend showdown on Monday, January 12, 2026, at 8:15 PM ET.Also Read: Ben Roethlisberger’s sister Carlee was a dual sportswoman, playing basketball and volleyball
